triples.name: Text corpus
triples.relevance: The paper introduces a new corpus for legal documents, which is a dataset resource for the research community.

triples.name: Text segmentation
triples.relevance: Segmenting legal documents into topical and coherent parts is a core technique used in the paper.

triples.name: Rhetorical structure theory
triples.relevance: The paper applies rhetorical roles (derived from RST) to annotate and classify document parts.

triples.name: Automatic summarization
triples.relevance: The paper demonstrates improved performance on document summarization using rhetorical roles.

triples.name: Document classification
triples.relevance: The paper develops baseline models for automatically predicting rhetorical roles (classifying document parts).

triples.name: Legal informatics
triples.relevance: The paper addresses automated processing of legal documents, which is a core application area of legal informatics.
